projectPurpose: To provide a dynamic, real-time monitoring tool for observing the performance and resource usage of running eBPF programs on Linux.
mainFeatures: Dynamic real-time view of running eBPF programs
Shows events per second per program

alternatives.name: bpftool
mainFeatures: Show basic statistics (runtime, run count) if enabled

alternatives.name: BCC (BPF Compiler Collection)
mainFeatures: Collection of pre-built eBPF tools for tracing and monitoring
Python and C interfaces for custom eBPF programs
Tools for I/O analysis, networking, etc.
Includes tools to inspect process activity

alternatives.name: Inspektor Gadget
mainFeatures: Tools for Kubernetes introspection and debugging
Includes 'top ebpf' gadget for K8s environments

marketPositioning: bpftop is positioned as a specialized, real-time performance monitoring tool specifically for eBPF programs on Linux. Unlike general system monitors or broader eBPF toolkits, it provides a dynamic, continuously updated view focused on the runtime, event rate, and CPU usage of individual eBPF programs. This makes it a focused tool for developers and system administrators who need immediate, detailed visibility into eBPF program performance, complementing the capabilities of more general eBPF management tools like bpftool and the extensive tracing capabilities of BCC and BPFtrace.
